snippet: Bela Biszku, a 92-year-old former interior minister, was on a committee of the Communist Party that ordered the shooting of Hungarians who rose up against Soviet rule more than half a century ago.
abstract: Prosecutors in Hungary charge 92-year-old former interior minister Bela Biszku with war crimes related to his suppression of civilians during the Hungarian uprising against Soviet rule in 1956.
lead_paragraph: Bela Biszku, a 92-year-old former interior minister, was on a committee of the Communist Party that ordered the shooting of Hungarians who rose up against Soviet rule more than half a century ago.

headline.main: Former Hungarian Official Charged With War Crimes in 1956 Uprising
headline.print_headline:
Hungary: Man Charged in War Crimes
During Uprising Against Soviets

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
